CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 15, 1954, pg. 13 reads: "Demonstrating Whirlpool - Mrs. Hazel Pearsall, popular young Pittsburgh housewife, is being shown the fine features of the new Whirlpool "20" Wringer washer by Ralph Ellison, Tumpson Company representative. The washer is to be given away free to some lucky person.  Just come to Tumpson's at 705 Penn Avenue and register."
TitMainTitle: Hazel Pearsall, wearing gingham skirt, and Ralph Ellison, standing next to Whirlpool washing machine, in Tumpson appliance store
